section.title: Jetty Embedded HelloWorld
section.para: This section provides a tutorial that shows how you can quickly develop embedded code against the Jetty API.

section.title: Downloading the Jars
section.para: Jetty is decomposed into many jars and dependencies to achieve a minimal footprint by selecting the minimal set of jars. Typically it is best to use something like Maven to manage jars, however this tutorial uses an aggregate Jar that contains all of the Jetty classes in one Jar. You can manually download the aggregate jetty-all Jar and the servlet api Jar using wget or similar command (for example, curl ) or a browser. Use wget as follows:
section.screen: mkdir Demo cd Demo wget -O jetty-all.jar -U none http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/eclipse/jetty/aggregate/jetty-all/9.0.0-RC1/jetty-all-9.0.0-RC1.jar wget -O servlet-api.jar -U none http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/eclipse/jetty/orbit/javax.servlet/3.0.0.v201112011016/javax.servlet-3.0.0.v201112011016.jar
